GT.content: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift
GT.linkedContent: demand for term & temporization, very structure of the thing, demand for limit, boundary, margin, a demand which dawns in gift-counter-gift

SPOM.content: jurer ou conjurer: the chance of thinking and its limit? the gift of its finitude? [nous gageons ici que la pensée ne vient jamais à bout de la pulsion conjuratoire]
SPOM.linkedContent: jurer ou conjurer: the chance of thinking and its limit? the gift of its finitude? [nous gageons ici que la pensée ne vient jamais à bout de la pulsion conjuratoire]

POOF.content: via Aristotle, loving the dead (beyond death, beyond life), carries philía to limit of its possibility, also its ultimate resource: horizon is limit & absence of limit, loss of horizon on the horizon, ahorizontality of horizon
POOF.linkedContent: via Aristotle, loving the dead (beyond death, beyond life), carries philía to limit of its possibility, also its ultimate resource: horizon is limit & absence of limit, loss of horizon on the horizon, ahorizontality of horizon

POOF.content: limit is also a chance: must receive address of other at particular address, in singular language
POOF.linkedContent: limit is also a chance: must receive address of other at particular address, in singular language

POOF.content: [intensity qua stability] an intensity can always increase & gain on itself out to its extreme limit; p. 142 Schmitt’s criteria [re: partisan] are false ones, quasi-concepts, criteria of degree of intensity (i.e. indefinitely extensive)
POOF.linkedContent: [intensity qua stability] an intensity can always increase & gain on itself out to its extreme limit; p. 142 Schmitt’s criteria [re: partisan] are false ones, quasi-concepts, criteria of degree of intensity (i.e. indefinitely extensive)

A.content: border as limit (oros, Grenze, re: nun or Jetzt [now-point] Heidegger underlines) or border as tracing (grammē, Linie)
A.linkedContent: border as limit (oros, Grenze, re: nun or Jetzt [now-point] Heidegger underlines) or border as tracing (grammē, Linie)

A.content: [Derrida quickly reviews many places in his own work where he studied aporetology, paradoxical limitrophy, double bind]
A.linkedContent: [Derrida quickly reviews many places in his own work where he studied aporetology, paradoxical limitrophy, double bind]

A.content: the 2 versions of aporia’s nonpassage: 1) impermeable, only opens via shibboleth, closed borders (i.e. during war) 2) impasse of no limit, limit too porous, no opposition btwn 2 sides
A.linkedContent: the 2 versions of aporia’s nonpassage: 1) impermeable, only opens via shibboleth, closed borders (i.e. during war) 2) impasse of no limit, limit too porous, no opposition btwn 2 sides

A.content: three limits: 1) territories, countries, languages, States… 2) discourses: theology, sciences… 3) types of border (conceptual de-terminations)
A.linkedContent: three limits: 1) territories, countries, languages, States… 2) discourses: theology, sciences… 3) types of border (conceptual de-terminations)

A.content: abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]
A.linkedContent: abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]

A.content: aporia of death, one of the place-names that forms following braid btwn 3 forms of limits, keeps it from coming undone [see pp. 78-80 border, closure, demarcation] 1) problematic closure (around thematic entity) 2) anthropological border (animals don’t have borders, laws) 3) conceptual demarcation, logical de-finition (decontaminate 2 concepts, oppose them rigorously)
A.linkedContent: aporia of death, one of the place-names that forms following braid btwn 3 forms of limits, keeps it from coming undone [see pp. 78-80 border, closure, demarcation] 1) problematic closure (around thematic entity) 2) anthropological border (animals don’t have borders, laws) 3) conceptual demarcation, logical de-finition (decontaminate 2 concepts, oppose them rigorously)

EM.content: the relevance accomplished in Hegelian metaphysics persists wherever metaphysics, our language, maintains its authority, even in pre-Hegelian systems (i.e. in Kant, figure of finitude organizes capacity to know from emergence of anthropological limit)
EM.linkedContent: the relevance accomplished in Hegelian metaphysics persists wherever metaphysics, our language, maintains its authority, even in pre-Hegelian systems (i.e. in Kant, figure of finitude organizes capacity to know from emergence of anthropological limit)

OH.content: horizon (ancient Greek) = limit; to see itself (Europe) on the horizon, is to see itself from its end, discourse of anamnesis—taste for finality (goût de fin), for death
OH.linkedContent: horizon (ancient Greek) = limit; to see itself (Europe) on the horizon, is to see itself from its end, discourse of anamnesis—taste for finality (goût de fin), for death

OH.content: responsibility: making a chance of the memory of a name, of the idiomatic limit > an opening of identity to its future
OH.linkedContent: responsibility: making a chance of the memory of a name, of the idiomatic limit > an opening of identity to its future

OH.content: all names designate a negative limit & a chance

PAS.content: Blanchot: circle of law is this: must be a crossing for there to be a limit, uncrossable that in its desire, its call, has already crossed the line [appele à franchir]
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: circle of law is this: must be a crossing for there to be a limit, uncrossable that in its desire, its call, has already crossed the line [appele à franchir]

S.content: following a limit in a way where division is almost impossible because it touches both sides of limit [re: limit btwn philosophemes and the sayings of Dichter]
S.linkedContent: following a limit in a way where division is almost impossible because it touches both sides of limit [re: limit btwn philosophemes and the sayings of Dichter]

TC.content: Artaud kept himself as close as possible to the limit, possibility & impossibility of pure theater
TC.linkedContent: Artaud kept himself as close as possible to the limit, possibility & impossibility of pure theater

T.content: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit
T.linkedContent: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit

T.content: play of limit/passage [re: Being as relevant movement of reappropriation], no question answer but displace concept of limit, limit of concept (can’t just create new limit)
T.linkedContent: play of limit/passage [re: Being as relevant movement of reappropriation], no question answer but displace concept of limit, limit of concept (can’t just create new limit)

T.content: if tympanum is a limit, unhinge concept of limit > no limit in general, every limus, the limes, short cut, the oblique
T.linkedContent: if tympanum is a limit, unhinge concept of limit > no limit in general, every limus, the limes, short cut, the oblique

T.content: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper
T.linkedContent: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper

FWT.content: for Lacan, madness—limit of human freedom

DS.content: sum can’t be totalized, nor is this non-totalizing exceeded by infinite richness of content of meaning or intention > define the limit otherwise: fold w/ no possibility of folding text back on itself (angle & intersection of re-mark), no reduction of its spacing > blank, fold: impossibility of (imaginary) theme beyond textual instance > these textual effects rich w/ kind of poverty, singular/regular monotony, disappear: one can’t see this because one thinks one is seeing themes
DS.linkedContent: sum can’t be totalized, nor is this non-totalizing exceeded by infinite richness of content of meaning or intention > define the limit otherwise: fold w/ no possibility of folding text back on itself (angle & intersection of re-mark), no reduction of its spacing > blank, fold: impossibility of (imaginary) theme beyond textual instance > these textual effects rich w/ kind of poverty, singular/regular monotony, disappear: one can’t see this because one thinks one is seeing themes

DS.content: if fold had a limit somewhere, if mark, margin, or marche (limit, threshold, border) was fold’s other > there would be no text
DS.linkedContent: if fold had a limit somewhere, if mark, margin, or marche (limit, threshold, border) was fold’s other > there would be no text

P.content: ideal limit acts as frame for pure philosophy
P.linkedContent: ideal limit acts as frame for pure philosophy

POS.content: keep at the limit, not the death, of philosophy, and besides, the dead wields a very specific power [Derrida does not believe in the death of whatever: God, book, philosophy]
POS.linkedContent: keep at the limit, not the death, of philosophy, and besides, the dead wields a very specific power [Derrida does not believe in the death of whatever: God, book, philosophy]

POS.content: “one is never installed w/in transgression, one never lives elsewhere, transgression implies that the limit is always at work”
POS.linkedContent: “one is never installed w/in transgression, one never lives elsewhere, transgression implies that the limit is always at work”

POS.content: if there’s a definition of differance, it’s the limit, interruption, destruction of Hegel’s relève, wherever it is
POS.linkedContent: if there’s a definition of differance, it’s the limit, interruption, destruction of Hegel’s relève, wherever it is

OS.content: Aristotle: [strange logic re: now as limit, whereas no determinate divisible thing has a unique limit]
OS.linkedContent: Aristotle: [strange logic re: now as limit, whereas no determinate divisible thing has a unique limit]

OS.content: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)

OS.content: this would be a gramme that erases its tracing in a circle, removes limit of point
OS.linkedContent: this would be a gramme that erases its tracing in a circle, removes limit of point

OS.content: like “point: line,” now as limit (peras) is only time’s accident, time not thought on basis of now, thus mathematization of time has limits (always accidents/potentialities) [taken in all senses]
OS.linkedContent: like “point: line,” now as limit (peras) is only time’s accident, time not thought on basis of now, thus mathematization of time has limits (always accidents/potentialities) [taken in all senses]

ROP.content: Foucault’s wager, the end (fin) of finite man: “man would be effaced, like a face drawn in sand at the edge or limit of the sea” > trait (of face, limit) splits, becomes a limit, erasing and multiplying this limit endlessly > self-relation of limit at once erases/multiplies limit
ROP.linkedContent: Foucault’s wager, the end (fin) of finite man: “man would be effaced, like a face drawn in sand at the edge or limit of the sea” > trait (of face, limit) splits, becomes a limit, erasing and multiplying this limit endlessly > self-relation of limit at once erases/multiplies limit

ATIA.content: transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]
ATIA.linkedContent: transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]

ATIA.content: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”
ATIA.linkedContent: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”

O.content: in thus remaining [outside of oppositions, i.e. sensible/intelligible], does a preface exist? son espacement (préface à une relecture) s’écarte au lieu de la khōra > remarkable limen of the text: what can be read of dissemination > limen: mark, march, margin, mise en marche: citation
O.linkedContent: in thus remaining [outside of oppositions, i.e. sensible/intelligible], does a preface exist? son espacement (préface à une relecture) s’écarte au lieu de la khōra > remarkable limen of the text: what can be read of dissemination > limen: mark, march, margin, mise en marche: citation

WAP.content: philosophy has no horizon, if horizon means a limit, a line that encircles or delimits a perspective (interdisciplinarity: more horizontal identities than ever)
WAP.linkedContent: philosophy has no horizon, if horizon means a limit, a line that encircles or delimits a perspective (interdisciplinarity: more horizontal identities than ever)

TB.content: translation: task of pure limit, an infinite labor to rejoin (doesn’t exclude gradations, virtuality, interval & in-btwn) > can one quote a signature?
TB.linkedContent: translation: task of pure limit, an infinite labor to rejoin (doesn’t exclude gradations, virtuality, interval & in-btwn) > can one quote a signature?

CHM.content: like nonmeaning, silence is the work’s limit & profound resource
CHM.linkedContent: like nonmeaning, silence is the work’s limit & profound resource

Gii.content: everything Heidegger says about man takes on meaning and value w/in oppositional limit to animal (it is dogmatic and serious)
Gii.linkedContent: everything Heidegger says about man takes on meaning and value w/in oppositional limit to animal (it is dogmatic and serious)

Gii.content: man’s hand infinitely removed from prehensile organs through the abyss of its being “durch einen Abgrund des Wesens”
Gii.linkedContent: man’s hand infinitely removed from prehensile organs through the abyss of its being “durch einen Abgrund des Wesens”

REST.content: line of detachment, the out-of-use, not only the one giving form to the shoes, there’s the line of the work qua picture in frame > frame makes a supplementary désoeuvrement, cuts out but also sews back together > all these cutting outs, the shoes, the laces, the frame itself, going btwn outside & inside, limits have to be thought as lace [p. 307 G-string as lace, gaine]
REST.linkedContent: line of detachment, the out-of-use, not only the one giving form to the shoes, there’s the line of the work qua picture in frame > frame makes a supplementary désoeuvrement, cuts out but also sews back together > all these cutting outs, the shoes, the laces, the frame itself, going btwn outside & inside, limits have to be thought as lace [p. 307 G-string as lace, gaine]

RM.content: metaphysics [quotes from DIF] is not “surrounded but traversed by its limits,” “marked on its inside by the multiple track (sillon) of its margin”
RM.linkedContent: metaphysics [quotes from DIF] is not “surrounded but traversed by its limits,” “marked on its inside by the multiple track (sillon) of its margin”

PF.content: impossible marks the limit of the possible or a power, the limit of an “I can”
PF.linkedContent: impossible marks the limit of the possible or a power, the limit of an “I can”

PF.content: passivity marks all unconditional pure events (gift, forgiveness, hospitality, death), marks and thus doubly limits most active, productive performativity
PF.linkedContent: passivity marks all unconditional pure events (gift, forgiveness, hospitality, death), marks and thus doubly limits most active, productive performativity

TR.content: it [re: Rousseau’s Confessions] precedes acc. substitution of one border for another: in this parergonal composition, in game of interlocking frames, we find mark of 2 limits: 1) crossing from Protestantism to Catholicism 2) [2x last word] last word of the other, last word of self
TR.linkedContent: it [re: Rousseau’s Confessions] precedes acc. substitution of one border for another: in this parergonal composition, in game of interlocking frames, we find mark of 2 limits: 1) crossing from Protestantism to Catholicism 2) [2x last word] last word of the other, last word of self

D.content: possibility (potency) of present is its own limit, inner fold, impossibility—its impotence (btwn presence/castration) > same goes for “history,” “form”: language of metaphysics
D.linkedContent: possibility (potency) of present is its own limit, inner fold, impossibility—its impotence (btwn presence/castration) > same goes for “history,” “form”: language of metaphysics

D.content: life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life
D.linkedContent: life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life

D.content: each germ is its own term—finds its term w/in itself as its own internal limit, faisant angle avec sa proper mort [tracing, grafting, semen already swarming (essaimée)]
D.linkedContent: each germ is its own term—finds its term w/in itself as its own internal limit, faisant angle avec sa proper mort [tracing, grafting, semen already swarming (essaimée)]

D.content: limits of square/cube—indefinitely specular unfolding/refolding: not limits at all > opening of its own inscription—tout autre, la même, another geometry to come [EROS]
D.linkedContent: limits of square/cube—indefinitely specular unfolding/refolding: not limits at all > opening of its own inscription—tout autre, la même, another geometry to come [EROS]

HST.content: limit (of forgiveness) cannot be crossed (infranchissable)—and is crossed insofar as it can’t be [hymen] > ultimate compassion, very test of substitution (impossible), to be hostage and hôte of the other
HST.linkedContent: limit (of forgiveness) cannot be crossed (infranchissable)—and is crossed insofar as it can’t be [hymen] > ultimate compassion, very test of substitution (impossible), to be hostage and hôte of the other

LI.content: Derrida likes excessively prolonging the pleasure of the threshold (limen) [?]
LI.linkedContent: Derrida likes excessively prolonging the pleasure of the threshold (limen) [?]

LI.content: argument of principle concerns a structural limit, argument is of the same kind as the set-argument [re: speech act theory’s own differentiation of itself from other theories, & thus its reliance on the metaphorical: ruined analogical value btwn speech act theory and other theories]
LI.linkedContent: argument of principle concerns a structural limit, argument is of the same kind as the set-argument [re: speech act theory’s own differentiation of itself from other theories, & thus its reliance on the metaphorical: ruined analogical value btwn speech act theory and other theories]

LI.content: iterability can be supplemented by differance, grapheme, trace > cannot be idealized, makes idealization possible but never pure, simple: iterability has an internal impure limit, prevents it from being identified, synthesized, reappropriated by that whose iteration it entame
LI.linkedContent: iterability can be supplemented by differance, grapheme, trace > cannot be idealized, makes idealization possible but never pure, simple: iterability has an internal impure limit, prevents it from being identified, synthesized, reappropriated by that whose iteration it entame

LI.content: iterability at once condition/limit of mastery: entame it
LI.linkedContent: iterability at once condition/limit of mastery: entame it

LI.content: though nothing exists outside context, limit of frame/border of context always entails nonclosure: outside penetrates, thus determines, inside
LI.linkedContent: though nothing exists outside context, limit of frame/border of context always entails nonclosure: outside penetrates, thus determines, inside

TN.content: limit, deprived of body, does not touch itself, does not let itself be touched
TN.linkedContent: limit, deprived of body, does not touch itself, does not let itself be touched

TN.content: Nancy’s partes extra partes, everything outside another outside; p. 14 fold of becoming-inside of the first outside, nothing but surfaces & outsides w/out insides: superficies of surfaces are limits, exposed to a touch that can only leave them intact, untouchable > irreducible disseminal divisibility
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s partes extra partes, everything outside another outside; p. 14 fold of becoming-inside of the first outside, nothing but surfaces & outsides w/out insides: superficies of surfaces are limits, exposed to a touch that can only leave them intact, untouchable > irreducible disseminal divisibility

TN.content: the haptical, for every finite existence, recalls what is coming [Socrates], marks the limit at which or from which the presentation announces itself
TN.linkedContent: the haptical, for every finite existence, recalls what is coming [Socrates], marks the limit at which or from which the presentation announces itself

TN.content: untouchable before vow of abstinence [cf. OG p. 109 spacing prior to prohibition of names]? a vow of abstinence requires promise of touch > touch haunting abstinence itself, intensifying transgression: unforgivable perjury at heart of interdict
TN.linkedContent: untouchable before vow of abstinence [cf. OG p. 109 spacing prior to prohibition of names]? a vow of abstinence requires promise of touch > touch haunting abstinence itself, intensifying transgression: unforgivable perjury at heart of interdict

TN.content: touching remains limitrophe > an inhibition constitutes its appetite: it eats w/out eating what it comes to cultivate, elevate, educate, dresser (train), trephein
TN.linkedContent: touching remains limitrophe > an inhibition constitutes its appetite: it eats w/out eating what it comes to cultivate, elevate, educate, dresser (train), trephein

TN.content: Nancy: limit must come to be touched not seen
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: limit must come to be touched not seen

TN.content: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision

TN.content: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline
TN.linkedContent: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline

TN.content: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss
TN.linkedContent: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss

TN.content: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it
TN.linkedContent: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it

TN.content: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)
TN.linkedContent: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)

TN.content: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)

TN.content: would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?
TN.linkedContent: would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?

TN.content: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure
TN.linkedContent: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure

TN.content: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin
TN.linkedContent: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin

TN.content: Nancy: no art of touch, touch is sense as threshold
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: no art of touch, touch is sense as threshold

TN.content: to proclaim “essential originarity” of technical [as Nancy does] translates this “law” into a classical language that meets its limit here
TN.linkedContent: to proclaim “essential originarity” of technical [as Nancy does] translates this “law” into a classical language that meets its limit here

TN.content: finite thinking: a limit that thinking touches w/out appropriating it for itself
TN.linkedContent: finite thinking: a limit that thinking touches w/out appropriating it for itself

TN.content: via Nancy’s finite thinking, infinitism of Christian flesh finds itself contesté at heart of l’attestation itself > we have no access to it but to refer touch to the limit
TN.linkedContent: via Nancy’s finite thinking, infinitism of Christian flesh finds itself contesté at heart of l’attestation itself > we have no access to it but to refer touch to the limit

TN.content: limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift possible
TN.linkedContent: limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift possible

TN.content: one never touches except by touching a limit at (à) the limit (truism in any profound thinking of limit)
TN.linkedContent: one never touches except by touching a limit at (à) the limit (truism in any profound thinking of limit)

TN.content: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
TN.linkedContent: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)

TN.content: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit
TN.linkedContent: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit

BSi.content: curiosus: avid knowledge and care (cura), Heidegger’s unwholesome curiosity (Neugier, Neugierde) > curious in the beast, in the madman (zoo, asylum): caring and locking up, installing limits, an art and technique, perhaps tekhnē itself
BSi.linkedContent: curiosus: avid knowledge and care (cura), Heidegger’s unwholesome curiosity (Neugier, Neugierde) > curious in the beast, in the madman (zoo, asylum): caring and locking up, installing limits, an art and technique, perhaps tekhnē itself

BSi.content: Derrida on how zoos hide limits, interiorize, hollowed-out (en creux) limits [ditch instead of bars] > repressive violence w/ liberal, idealist, spiritualist grimace
BSi.linkedContent: Derrida on how zoos hide limits, interiorize, hollowed-out (en creux) limits [ditch instead of bars] > repressive violence w/ liberal, idealist, spiritualist grimace

BSi.content: logics of closure/enclosure, the threshold, le seuil interdit, question of responsibility (a question of threshold) throughout a decade of seminars [Derrida’s]
BSi.linkedContent: logics of closure/enclosure, the threshold, le seuil interdit, question of responsibility (a question of threshold) throughout a decade of seminars [Derrida’s]

BSi.content: not only do we not have a key to threshold, deconstruction doubts existence of threshold worthy of the  name (threshold supposes indivisibility & solidity of ground)
BSi.linkedContent: not only do we not have a key to threshold, deconstruction doubts existence of threshold worthy of the name (threshold supposes indivisibility & solidity of ground)

BSi.content: threshold (seuil), sill, soil, sole, solum, ground > are these ever secure?
BSi.linkedContent: threshold (seuil), sill, soil, sole, solum, ground > are these ever secure?

BSi.content: every economy & ecology presupposes limits, thresholds, and therefore (bunches of) keys
BSi.linkedContent: every economy & ecology presupposes limits, thresholds, and therefore (bunches of) keys

BSi.content: zoos, asylums: made people, all the mad animals, love the ecosystem of limits
BSi.linkedContent: zoos, asylums: made people, all the mad animals, love the ecosystem of limits

BSi.content: threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself
BSi.linkedContent: threshold as solid, indivisible, threshold as arkhē: commencement and commandment > archon, figure of sovereign himself

BSi.content: the motif of passage of what passes and comes to pass (passe et se passe) in history has no solid foundation, no indivisible line > requires a rethinking the figure of of threshold, requires greater vigilance to our irrepressible desire for single, solid threshold
BSi.linkedContent: the motif of passage of what passes and comes to pass (passe et se passe) in history has no solid foundation, no indivisible line > requires a rethinking the figure of of threshold, requires greater vigilance to our irrepressible desire for single, solid threshold

BSi.content: abyss not a bottom or bottomless depth of hidden base > if there is abyss, there’s plus d’un sol, plus d’un seul seuil, plus d’un seul seul [(no) more (than one) solid, single threshold, single single]
BSi.linkedContent: abyss not a bottom or bottomless depth of hidden base > if there is abyss, there’s plus d’un sol, plus d’un seul seuil, plus d’un seul seul [(no) more (than one) solid, single threshold, single single]

OG.content: supplement extends beyond man: man calls himself man by drawing limits (excluding other): purity of nature, madness, divinity, childhood
OG.linkedContent: supplement extends beyond man: man calls himself man by drawing limits (excluding other): purity of nature, madness, divinity, childhood

OG.content: approach to limits (madness, divinity, childhood, animality, etc.) feared as threat of death & desired as life w/out differance: truth-value of these limit concepts only has meaning w/in closure of game (clôture du jeu), they belong to an epoch of supplementarity
OG.linkedContent: approach to limits (madness, divinity, childhood, animality, etc.) feared as threat of death & desired as life w/out differance: truth-value of these limit concepts only has meaning w/in closure of game (clôture du jeu), they belong to an epoch of supplementarity

OG.content: must be death via grapheme before phoneme: word & thing are referential limits produced/marked by supplementarity
OG.linkedContent: must be death via grapheme before phoneme: word & thing are referential limits produced/marked by supplementarity

UWC.content: sovereign mastery of interior (proper power) ([indivisible] border of inside/outside) vs. divisible limit  (because divisible, it has a history) > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the “perhaps,” the “if”
UWC.linkedContent: sovereign mastery of interior (proper power) ([indivisible] border of inside/outside) vs. divisible limit (because divisible, it has a history) > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the “perhaps,” the “if”

EU.content: [re: politico-juridical system of university] Derrida beyond [?] political right/left, on the side of a tireless parasite [passe et repasse la limite] seeking conflict or perpetual peace in a university that has from its birth (dès sa naissance) en mal (been wanting) d’apocalypse et d’eschatologie
EU.linkedContent: [re: politico-juridical system of university] Derrida beyond [?] political right/left, on the side of a tireless parasite [passe et repasse la limite] seeking conflict or perpetual peace in a university that has from its birth (dès sa naissance) en mal (been wanting) d’apocalypse et d’eschatologie

EU.content: [CIPH] external/internal limitrophes > give them a place and opportunity worthy of them: l’exploration aux limites, singular, out-of-ordinary (insolite) incursions, limitrophic or aleatory
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] external/internal limitrophes > give them a place and opportunity worthy of them: l’exploration aux limites, singular, out-of-ordinary (insolite) incursions, limitrophic or aleatory

EU.content: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.
EU.linkedContent: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.

EU.content: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma
EU.linkedContent: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma

EU.content: Derrida declares limits in order to lift/distance/disappropriate them [Rousseau describes doesn’t declare]
EU.linkedContent: Derrida declares limits in order to lift/distance/disappropriate them [Rousseau describes doesn’t declare]

SPEC.content: to speculate: not only going beyond a given oppositional limit but the very notion of limit as front btwn two opposed terms—eg. the identifiable terms where every term terminates: life/death [Derrida’s eschatology?]
SPEC.linkedContent: to speculate: not only going beyond a given oppositional limit but the very notion of limit as front btwn two opposed terms—eg. the identifiable terms where every term terminates: life/death [Derrida’s eschatology?]

SPEC.content: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself
SPEC.linkedContent: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself

SPEC.content: pleasure—ungraspable limit btwn 2 limits, un en-deçà et un au-delà qui réduisent un pas à rien ——producing itself, regenerating: only pleasure, pleasure as counter-pleasure, band contra band, tout se passe alors dans des différences de bandage—not general economy (absolute expenditure) but strictural economy (to the point of its inevitable collapse)
SPEC.linkedContent: pleasure—ungraspable limit btwn 2 limits, un en-deçà et un au-delà qui réduisent un pas à rien ——producing itself, regenerating: only pleasure, pleasure as counter-pleasure, band contra band, tout se passe alors dans des différences de bandage—not general economy (absolute expenditure) but strictural economy (to the point of its inevitable collapse)

SPEC.content: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
SPEC.linkedContent: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death

FV.content: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits
FV.linkedContent: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits
